Home
  • Seminars

Geometrical and Topological Data Analysis

Feb. 28th, 14h-17h

Slides

  • Gabriel Peyré (CNRS and ENS): Mesh Processing Meets Graph Theory.
  • Pierre Alliez (INRIA): Digital Geometry Processing.
  • Julien Tierny (CNRS and Paris 6): Topological Data Analysis for Scientific Vizualization.

Computational resources

  • VTK, for vizualization.
  • Paraview, for vizualization.
  • For low dimensional topological data analysis: TTK (available in April 2017).
  • For topological inference in high dimension: Gudhi.
  • The numerical Tours of Signal Processing (in Matlab and Python) contains a section dedicated to mesh processing, including denoising, spectral analysis, parameterization, deformation.
  • CGAL library

Bibliography

Here is a (biased) bibliography related to the lectures.

Related to vizualization:

  • The Visualization Handbook, Johnson and Hansen, 2004.
  • The Visualization ToolKit, Schroeder, Martin, Lorensen, 2006.
  • Webpage of a course at ENSTA by Julien Tierny.
  • A tutorial by Julien Tierny on paraview.
  • A first tutorial by Julien Tierny on C++/VTK.
  • A second one.

Related to topological data analysis:

  • The definitive reference: Computational Topology: An Introduction, Edelsbrunner and Harer, AMS, 2010.
  • Course notes by Julien Tirerny
  • Course notes by Frédéric Chazal, in particular chap 11 for material related to statistical inference and machine learning.

Related to geometry processing:

  • Polygon Mesh Processing, Mario Botsch, Leif Kobbelt, Mark Pauly, Pierre Alliez, Bruno Levy.
  • A Survey of Surface Reconstruction from Point Clouds, Matthew Berger, Andrea Tagliasacchi, Lee Seversky, Pierre Alliez, Gael Guennebaud, Joshua Levine, Andrei Sharf, Claudio Silva.
